simple.util

Class do_io

  • java.lang.Object
    • simple.util.do_io
  • Deprecated. 
    App,FilterFactory,StreamFactory,ReadWriterFactory

    @Deprecated
public final class do_io
extends java.lang.Object
    Does various IO things.
    Other dependencies:
    simple.util.do_str
    simple.util.logging.*
    Created: 2004
    Author:
    Kenneth Pierce

      • getFiles

        public static java.util.Vector<java.io.File> getFiles(java.io.File start,
                                                      boolean recursive)
        Deprecated. 
        Adds all the files to a giant vector. Can add them recursively. NOTE: will not add directories. Might add symbolic links.
        Parameters:
        start - Directory to start in.
        recursive - Whether or not to add files of sub-directories.
        Returns:
        A vector containing all the files.

      • getResourceAsFile

        @Deprecated
public static java.io.File getResourceAsFile(java.lang.String location)
                                                   throws java.net.URISyntaxException,
                                                          java.io.FileNotFoundException
        Deprecated. App
        Attempts to create a File object that references the location of the file.
        It will use the do_io class as the loading class. NOTE: This is very prone to fail if the URL returned is not a normal file. The file is considered abnormal if the protocol of the returned URL is not 'file'.
        Parameters:
        location - Location of the file relative to the "start in" folder.
        Returns:
        A File object referencing the URL returned from Class.getResource(String).
        Throws:
        java.net.URISyntaxException - Happens if the returned URL cannot be transformed into a valid URI. This should never occur.
        java.io.FileNotFoundException
        See Also:
        Class.getResource(String)

      • getResourceAsFile

        @Deprecated
public static java.io.File getResourceAsFile(java.lang.String location,
                                                          java.lang.Class<?> loader)
                                                   throws java.io.FileNotFoundException
        Deprecated. App
        Attempts to create a File object that references the location of the file.
        It will use the loader class as the loading class. NOTE: This is very prone to fail if the URL returned is not a normal file. The file is considered abnormal if the protocol of the returned URL is not 'file'.
        Parameters:
        location - Location of the file relative to the "start in" folder.
        loader - Class to use to load the file.
        Returns:
        A File object referencing the URL returned from Class.getResource(String).
        Throws:
        java.io.FileNotFoundException - Occurs if the loader returns a null. Avoids a nasty nondescript NullPointerException.
        See Also:
        Class.getResource(String)
